text:
I just installed and ran Apache Web Server for the First time.

On two of my three computers, the "Test Page of Apache Installation" is in 
English, easily legible.  on my other computer, the page is in Japanese.

I have the Japanese Language pack installed, but English is always my first 
choice.  The same thing happened on apache.org when I went to the help 
section.  It loaded first in Japanese, then I had to find the "En" link.

The Computers:


The Two in English

500Mhz Athlon
256MB PC133 RAM
20GB HD
Windows 98 SE, All available updates installed
Internet Explorer 6.0 SP1, fully updated

(Apache Server installed on)
400Mhz Pentium II
256 MB PC100 RAM
25GB HD
Windows XP Pro, All available updates installed
Internet Explorer 6.0 SP1, fully updated

The Other One:

Athlon XP 2100+
512 DDR 2100 RAM
210 GB HD(s)
Windows XP Pro, All available updates installed
Internet Explorer 6.0 SP1, fully updated
creator: Tremayne@alexandria.cc
slive@apache.org
text:
In Internet Explorer, go to tools->options->languages and make sure that
the first listed language is "en" (NOT "en-us", "en-gb", or anything else.)

creator: Tremayne@alexandria.cc
text:
That's the way it was.  Sorry to burst your bubble.  Still Japanese on that 
one system.

BTW only one of the others had "English [en]" as the first choice.  the other 
(that did work) had "English(United States) [en-us]"

Not resolved yet.

creator: nd@perlig.de
text:
Please ask in a user support forum how to set up your browser. This is a bug
database.

Thanks.

creator: Tremayne@alexandria.cc
text:
Kindly do NOT Tell me to ask the user support forum for help on setting up my 
browser.  I know how do do this and DID SO.  The problem is with Apache.  
Kindly DO NOT insult me.  AND DO NOT RESPOND WITH ANSWERS LIKE THAT.  This is 
a bug report, not a redirect-the-other-developer-to-a-useless-forum page.

Sorry to everyone else, I can't stand people talking down to me.

Bug still persists.

creator: nd@perlig.de
text:
Would you mind to provide some useful information, i.e. the exact set of
Accept-Language headers sent by the browsers?

Enough is enough.  The headers match on all three accesses.  Page still in 
Japanese, but I read it so, it's ok.  Bug resoved (i.e. swept under the rug)
creator: Tremayne@alexandria.cc

text:
*sigh* What now? How do you think can we resolve your problem without any
information?

Please post your Accept-Headers (you can log them with %{Accept-Language}i and
%{Accept}i, what is the accompanying config?

What we won't fix is not your decision.
creator: nd@perlig.de

text:
Whatever.

The probability of a real bug here is very low, and even if there is
one, it is impossible to identify without a cooperative reporter.
creator: slive@apache.org
nd@perlig.de
text:
No further response. Feel free to reopen the report if you can supply the
requested information. Thanks.
